dialogue.raw_text: I'm living with my cousin. He has two kids. And his mother. I mean his wife...I'm sorry, I am very nervous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zainab starts to break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zainab smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both smile at the thought of Walter still at Zainab's table.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Have you spoken with Tarek?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. He called me this morning. He is doing all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish that I could see him. Just for a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me too. How long have you been here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two years. I was in detention when I first arrived. Three months. It was horrible. I would probably still be there but they closed the facility for poor conditions. They released some of the women on parole because we were...low risk. I met Tarek one year later. (Beat) I am sorry for what happened with Tarek. I hope you do not blame me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Blame you?     No. I do not blame you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tarek was doing nothing wrong. I miss him so much. I don't know what I am going to do without him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said the same thing about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zainab, I would like you to do something for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would like you to show me something that you and Tarek liked to do. Some place that you like to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . But maybe we should get Walter first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna walk down the street listening to Zainab who is wheeling her jewelry supplies behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter, Mouna and Zainab are standing at the railing of the Ferry which is making its way across the harbor. The STATUE OF LIBERTY looms large; the ferry route providing a perfect vantage point.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So what is in Staten Island?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. We never got off. We just would go to the other side and then come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's free. And it felt like we were going somewhere. Mouna smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zainab crosses to the other railing and points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zainab smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter's cell phone rings. He looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks away from the Mouna and Zainab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter hangs up the phone and rejoins Mouna and Zainab.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That is where the towers were. I never saw them but Tarek did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And over there is the Statue.    And behind that is Ellis Island.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sometimes Tarek would point at the statue and jump up and down like we were arriving to New York for the first time. It was very funny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you go up in the Statue?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me. (Into the phone) Hello? Oh. Hi Charles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that? Yes. I'm still in New York actually. I stayed down here to do some research. What's that? Oh. I'm on a boat. Yes, a boat. (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen Charles, I'll explain when I see you but I have to go right now. I'll call you back. Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter is visiting with Tarek. Another detainee walks behind Tarek and taps him on the shoulder. Tarek nods hello and then keeps talking to Walter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tarek looks around the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did Zainab tell you how we used pretend we arriving in New York for the first time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know they don't even let us outside here. They just cut a hole in the roof in one place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And they seemed to get along? Zainab and my mother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I think your mother likes her very much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tarek smiles. Then it fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tarek thinks for a long moment. He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My mother's not going home, is she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know she's thinking about my father. He spent seven years in jail in Syria for something he wrote in the newspaper. By the time they released him he was very sick. He died two months later. That's when we came here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She thinks the same thing is gonna happen to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know I have never seen them together. Zainab and my mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . NEW YORK STREET, NIGHT Walter and Mouna are walking home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WALTER'S APARTMENT, KITCHEN - LATER Mouna is preparing dinner. Walter comes in and takes a bottle of wine out of the refrigerator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter pours his glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walks out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you hungry, Mouna? We can stop for dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would prefer to cook if you don't mind?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Should we stop at a market?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. That's probably a good idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like a glass of wine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mouna? I need to go back to Connecticut tomorrow. For work. I told Tarek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How long will you be gone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know yet. I'll try to make it back to visit Tarek as soon as I can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have keep visiting him, Walter. I'm sure you are busy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll see what I can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mouna and Walter are eating in silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you go to Broadway, Walter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Broadway? Uhm. No. I haven't been in a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tarek sent me the CD for "Phantom of the Opera" for my birthday. The music is lovely. Have you seen it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter seems caught off guard by the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter drinks his glass of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter is agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter's cheap shot lands. Mouna is stung.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is an awkward silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter picks up the wine bottle and fills his glass.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't either but I think I know every word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tarek is teaching me the drum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I sound a lot better when he's playing with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How is your teaching going, Walter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...I have a lighter schedule so I can work on my book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your book? What is it about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it covers quite a bit, so it's hard to explain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't like to talk about your work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. It's just a bit complicated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It just is. It's just not a process that's easy to talk about with someone who's not a writer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shouldn't have spoken to you like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter is sitting on the edge of his bed and takes off his shoes. He pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An empty New York street. Mouna and Walter round the corner walking together. She is holding his briefcase. Walter is carrying the drum and his duffle bag. They arrive at the Parking Garage. Walter hands a ticket to the GARAGE ATTENDANT. He takes his briefcase from Mouna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna turns and walks down the street. Walter's car arrives.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you. You have my number if you need anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be fine. Thank you. Have a safe trip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter pulls into his driveway. He gets out of the car. He opens the trunk and takes out his bag and then his drum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walks into the lecture hall. He sets his briefcase down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes out some papers and opens them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter is stopped at a traffic light in town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter sees Karen walking toward him. She is talking on her cell phone and does not notice him. Walter just watches her pass without saying a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter sits in his office working. He stops and listens to the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WALTER'S LIVING ROOM - LATER Walter pours himself a drink and wanders around the empty house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter opens the front door and walks outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walks onto the front lawn and looks around the sleepy neighborhood. He listens to the quiet. It's a stark contrast from New York.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter roots through his briefcase and pulls out the FELA KUTI CD. He slips the CD into the stereo. He presses play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KUTI's, "DON'T GAG ME" blares over the speakers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter is sitting in a chair and playing the drum along with the Fela song. He is only wearing a T-shirt and boxers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles talks to Walter. They stand up and shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three MOVERS are carefully removing the piano from Walter's house as Walter and Barbara Watson look on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter drives back down the highway. The Fela Kuti music is playing. He is tapping on the steering wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walks quickly up the stairs to the fourth floor. He seems to be moving with a little more pep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he approaches his door, he hears music emanating from his apartment. It's a PIANO SONATA. The music stops him in his tracks. He listens for a couple of moments. Finally he walks inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter enters to find Mouna mopping the floor.   Fresh flowers are on the table. She sees Walter and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns down the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She picks up the CD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna sets down the CD. She notices Walter's glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter leaves. Then he returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter nods and walks toward his room. Mouna watches him go and smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I did not expect you so soon. I was just cleaning a bit. I hope you don't mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like this CD very much.   The music is lovely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was going to make some lunch. Are you hungry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was wondering if...Thursday night ... Do you have plans?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Walter, I have no plans.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I thought that...we might do something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Tarek are talking. Tarek is very anxious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tarek's question stops Walter in his tracks. Tarek tries to regain his composure.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I think to other detention centers. Two Moroccan guys were just moved. They had no idea. Suddenly they were just gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Has anyone said anything to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one in here knows anything. I'm not a criminal. I have committed no crime. What do they think? I'm a terrorist? There are no terrorists in here. The terrorists have money. They have support. This is not fair!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Angrily) How do you know?! You're out there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just... I'm starting to wonder if I'm ever going to get out of here. I sit in here at night and I keep thinking about Zainab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just want to play my music and live my life. What's so wrong about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter, Mouna and Zainab are sitting at a cafe. Walter is on his cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . OK. Please do. Thank you. Bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He would make some calls but they can move him to another facility at their discretion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said it could be anywhere. Upstate. Pennsylvania. There is even one in Louisiana.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Louisiana? Where they had the floods?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did the lawyer say anything else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No he didn't know anything else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one seems to know anything. It feels like Syria.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Darren and the Bass player are playing. They have a new drummer. Mouna and Zainab sit at a back table talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna notices Zainab's necklace. Zainab takes it off and gives it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter buys two newspapers. One in English and one in Arabic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna walks along the street. She stops at a small CLOTHING STORE and looks into the window. She walks into the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna is sitting on her bed, speaking in Arabic. Walter, dressed in a jacket and tie, is sitting in his bedroom. Suddenly Mouna appears in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They leave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He says hello. He wants to make sure that you are practicing your drum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am. You look very nice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna ride in the cab. Mouna looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cab pulls over. Walter and Mouna climb out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This city is just so huge! It never ends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter pays the Cab Driver and turns to Mouna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter points to the "Phantom of the Opera" marquee behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles as he and Mouna walk toward the theatre.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Really? The Phantom? Are we seeing it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's wonderful. Thank you. I am so excited.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The lights and sounds of Times Square. Walter and Mouna walk through the throngs of tourists after the play. Walter hails a cab and they jump in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna both sit in a French restaurant finishing their salad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The both smile. A WAITER approaches and picks up their plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Waiter leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Waiter sets down the two GLASSES of wine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have to say that show was really kind of scary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. It was kind of scary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very good. But I think I would like a glass of wine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. I didn't even think to ask.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's OK. It's not every night that you see The Phantom. (To the Waiter) I'll have a cabernet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't been to theatre in a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me neither. There is a place in Syria called Maaloula. It is a huge outdoor theater. It's beautiful. We used to take Tarek there to see concerts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (In Arabic) Cheers. They clink glasses and drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter is suddenly self-conscious. Walter is suddenly self-conscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her simple words strike a chord with Walter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is beginning to unravel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter trails off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Waiter returns and pours some more water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter considers this as if for the first time. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mouna, I've taken a leave of absence for the rest of the semester.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just thought I might spend some more time in New York.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter, you do not have to do this for Tarek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you have to be in Connecticut. You have your teaching. And your book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is not your problem, Walter. It's OK that you are busy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not busy. Not at all. (Beat) Mouna, the truth is I haven't been doing any work for a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You just presented your paper at the conference.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't even write it. I just read it. I've been teaching the same course for twenty years. It doesn't mean anything to me. None of it does. I pretend. I pretend that I'm busy. That I'm writing. Working. But I'm not doing anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be. I appreciate you telling me this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter, what would you do if you didn't teach?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think that is exciting. Not to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I work in a car dealership. I take care of the accounting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mouna and Walter walk into the apartment. Mouna takes off her coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna is touched by the comment. Her mood shifts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with that she turns and walks into her bedroom.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My God. Twelve-thirty! I have not been up this late in a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think that happens a lot in New York.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Walter. That was a very nice evening. It's the most fun I've had in a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told Tarek I was going to take you. He was very happy about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter wakes up. He checks his watch. He notices that his phone is blinking. A message. He picks it up and listens to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws open the door and hurries into the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna is sitting at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without another word, Mouna is up and putting on her coat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's a message from Tarek. Something's wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just that they were moving him. He didn't know what it meant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna ride in the cab. Walter is on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well when do you expect him back? Can you have him call me the minute he is? It's an emergency. Thank you. (He hangs up.) He's still in court. (To the CAB DRIVER) Can you hurry please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna get out of the cab. Walter rushes in. Mouna waits outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walks up to the guard booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MALE GUARD checks the computer screen. Walter waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Guard picks up the phone and dials. He has a long conversation that Walter cannot hear. There are a few other visitors in the waiting room. They watch Walter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter's wheels are spinning. He is helpless. He looks around the room at all of the other immigrants visiting friends and family members. They are watching him with blank faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter doesn't move. He checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally, Walter turns and starts to walk out of the detention center. He reaches the exit and then spins around and storms back toward the guard booth. He completely loses control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Guard just stares back blankly. The other visitors watch in disbelief. They are unaccustomed to this type of outburst as is Walter who now stands trembling in the middle of the room. It's as if something inside him snapped. Something that he has been holding on to for a long time. He is suddenly adrift. Unsure of what to do next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter turns. Mouna is standing there. He looks at her. Helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter looks a bit lost. He looks back at the Guard who just stares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches out and takes Walter's hand. And then she leads him out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello. I'm here for bed 38. Tarek Khalil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is no longer with us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not sure? Was he moved to another facility? Another state? What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I just know that this detainee is no longer in the facility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well can you ask someone who does know?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He...how can that be? Is there any way to contact him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't think so? What kind of answer is that?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir. That's all the information that I have. Now please step away from the window. You can call the ICE if you have any further questions. The number is on the wall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir. Please step away from my window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir. For the last time, step away from my window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Angrily shouting) You can't just take people away like that! Do you hear me?! He was a good man. A good person! He had a life here! You can't just take away whoever you want! (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not fair! We are not just helpless children! Do you hear me?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walter. Let's go. There is nothing we can do. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna ride in a taxi. They are both depleted. Mouna shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is overwhelmed by the events. She breaks down and starts to cry. Walter puts his arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter watches as Mouna tells Zainab. Zainab buckles and hugs Mouna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WALTER'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Walter is looking out the window. Mouna walks out of the kitchen and turns out the light. She walks over and stands next to Walter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter just looks at her. The news is piercing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna smiles warmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna leans in and kisses him gently on the cheek. She turns and walks toward her room. Walter watches her go and then looks back onto the street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Walter, I need to go back to Syria. I should to be there for Tarek.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When are you going to leave?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tomorrow. I already bought a ticket. It's best for me to be there as soon as possible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You won't be able to come back here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter is lying awake in bed. There is a knock at the door. He sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door opens and a shaft of light cuts across the room. Mouna stands in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter stares at her for a moment and then turns down the bed sheets. Mouna walks over and lies down next time. Walter pulls the sheets back over her. They sit in silence for a long moment holding each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter can only listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter gently touches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his arm around her and she collapses into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They lie together.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's my fault. What happened to Tarek. I did receive the letter telling us to leave. I threw it away. I never told him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were here for three years by the time the letter arrived. I had found a job. Tarek was in school. Everyone told me not to worry. That the government did not care. And it appeared to be true. And then, after time, you forget. You think that you really belong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mouna and Walter are sitting in the airport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna takes a small decorative pouch out of her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter takes it and opens it. It's a WRIST BAND from Zainab's collection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna puts it on Walter's wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter smiles. Mouna checks her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The both stand up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Have you visited your son in London?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zainab and I picked it out especially for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So do I. You look cool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. You are very cool, Walter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter and Mouna arrive at the security check point. Mouna sets down her bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leans in and they hug long and hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mouna kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she picks up her bag and walks off. Walter watches her go. She turns and waves. Walter waves back and then she disappears into the security check point.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want you to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (She whispers) I don't want to go, habibi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Walter walks quickly along the street with his drum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter approaches the subway and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter swipes his card and walks down into the subway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walter walks along the subway platform. He stops about midway and sits down on a bench. The uptown subway train enters and obscures our view of him. Finally the train pulls away. Walter is still sitting but now he is playing his drum. He is fully committed. Another train wipes frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zainab sits behind her table, staring straight ahead. We hold on her for a long moment and then...
direction.name: direction
